org.apache.gora.solr.store

Class SolrStore<K,T extends PersistentBase>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.gora.store.impl.DataStoreBase<K,T>
      • org.apache.gora.solr.store.SolrStore<K,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - class to be used for the key
    T - class to be persisted within the store
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, DataStore<K,T>, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable, org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable

    public class SolrStore<K,T extends PersistentBase>
extends DataStoreBase<K,T>
    Implementation of a Solr data store to be used by gora.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static int DEFAULT_BATCH_SIZE
      The default batch size (ArrayList) of SolrDocuments to be used in the event of an absent value for solr.batchSize.

      Default schema index with value "0" used when AVRO Union data types are stored

      A batch size unit (ArrayList) of SolrDocument's to be used for writing to Solr.

      The solrconfig.xml file to be used - defined in gora.properties

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MAPPING_FILE

        protected static final String DEFAULT_MAPPING_FILE
        The default file name value to be used for obtaining the Solr object field mapping's
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_URL_PROPERTY

        protected static final String SOLR_URL_PROPERTY
        The URL of the Solr server - defined in gora.properties
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_CONFIG_PROPERTY

        protected static final String SOLR_CONFIG_PROPERTY
        The solrconfig.xml file to be used - defined in gora.properties
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_SCHEMA_PROPERTY

        protected static final String SOLR_SCHEMA_PROPERTY
        The schema.xml file to be used - defined in gora.properties
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_BATCH_SIZE_PROPERTY

        protected static final String SOLR_BATCH_SIZE_PROPERTY
        A batch size unit (ArrayList) of SolrDocument's to be used for writing to Solr. Should be defined in gora.properties. A default value of 100 is used if this value is absent. This value must be of type Integer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_SOLRJSERVER_IMPL

        protected static final String SOLR_SOLRJSERVER_IMPL
        The solrj implementation to use. This has a default value of http for HttpSolrClient. Available options include http, cloud, concurrent and loadbalance. Defined in gora.properties This value must be of type String.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_SERVER_USER_AUTH

        protected static final String SOLR_SERVER_USER_AUTH
        Whether to use secured Solr client or not. Available options include true, and false. Defined in gora.properties This value must be of type boolean.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_SERVER_USERNAME

        protected static final String SOLR_SERVER_USERNAME
        Solr client username. Solr client user authentication should be enabled for this property. Defined in gora.properties This value must be of type String.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_SERVER_PASSWORD

        protected static final String SOLR_SERVER_PASSWORD
        Solr client password. Solr client user authentication should be enabled for this property. Defined in gora.properties This value must be of type String.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_COMMIT_WITHIN_PROPERTY

        protected static final String SOLR_COMMIT_WITHIN_PROPERTY
        A batch commit unit for SolrDocument's used when making (commit) calls to Solr. Should be defined in gora.properties. A default value of 1000 is used if this value is absent. This value must be of type Integer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SOLR_RESULTS_SIZE_PROPERTY

        protected static final String SOLR_RESULTS_SIZE_PROPERTY
        The maximum number of result to return when we make a call to execute(Query). This should be defined in gora.properties. This value must be of type Integer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_BATCH_SIZE

        protected static final int DEFAULT_BATCH_SIZE
        The default batch size (ArrayList) of SolrDocuments to be used in the event of an absent value for solr.batchSize. Set to 100 by default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_COMMIT_WITHIN

        protected static final int DEFAULT_COMMIT_WITHIN
        The default commit size of SolrDocuments to be used in the event of an absent value for solr.commitSize. Set to 1000 by default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_RESULTS_SIZE

        protected static final int DEFAULT_RESULTS_SIZE
        The default results size of SolrDocuments to be used in the event of an absent value for solr.resultsSize. Set to 100 by default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_UNION_SCHEMA

        public static final int DEFAULT_UNION_SCHEMA
        Default schema index with value "0" used when AVRO Union data types are stored
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Class<K> keyClass,
                       Class<T> persistentClass,
                       Properties properties)
        Initialize the data store by reading the credentials, setting the client's properties up and reading the mapping file. Initialize is called when then the call to DataStoreFactory.createDataStore(java.lang.Class<D>, java.lang.Class<K>, java.lang.Class<T>, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration) is made.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface DataStore<K,T extends PersistentBase>
        Overrides:
        initialize in class DataStoreBase<K,T extends PersistentBase>
        Parameters:
        keyClass -
        persistentClass -
        properties -

        public String getSchemaName()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Returns the schema name given to this DataStore
        Returns:
        schema name

      • createSchema

        public void createSchema()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Creates the optional schema or table (or similar) in the datastore to hold the objects. If the schema is already created previously, or the underlying data model does not support or need this operation, the operation is ignored.

      • truncateSchema

        public void truncateSchema()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Deletes all the data associated with the schema, but keeps the schema (table or similar) intact.
        Specified by:
        truncateSchema in interface DataStore<K,T extends PersistentBase>
        Overrides:
        truncateSchema in class DataStoreBase<K,T extends PersistentBase>

      • deleteSchema

        public void deleteSchema()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Deletes the underlying schema or table (or similar) in the datastore that holds the objects. This also deletes all the data associated with the schema.

      • schemaExists

        public boolean schemaExists()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Returns whether the schema that holds the data exists in the datastore.
        Returns:
        whether schema exists

        public static String escapeQueryKey(String key)

        public T get(K key,
             String[] fields)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Returns the object corresponding to the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the object
        fields - the fields required in the object. Pass null, to retrieve all fields
        Returns:
        the Object corresponding to the key or null if it cannot be found

      • put

        public void put(K key,
                T persistent)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Inserts the persistent object with the given key. If an object with the same key already exists it will silently be replaced. See also the note on visibility.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(K key)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Deletes the object with the given key
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the object
        Returns:
        whether the object was successfully deleted

      • deleteByQuery

        public long deleteByQuery(Query<K,T> query)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Deletes all the objects matching the query. See also the note on visibility.
        Parameters:
        query - matching records to this query will be deleted
        Returns:
        number of deleted records

      • execute

        public Result<K,T> execute(Query<K,T> query)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Executes the given query and returns the results.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute.
        Returns:
        the results as a Result object.

      • newQuery

        public Query<K,T> newQuery()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Constructs and returns a new Query.
        Returns:
        a new Query.

      • getPartitions

        public List<PartitionQuery<K,T>> getPartitions(Query<K,T> query)
                                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Partitions the given query and returns a list of PartitionQuerys, which will execute on local data.
        Parameters:
        query - the base query to create the partitions for. If the query is null, then the data store returns the partitions for the default query (returning every object)
        Returns:
        a List of PartitionQuery's
        Throws:
        IOException

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Forces the write caches to be flushed. DataStore implementations may optimize their writing by deferring the actual put / delete operations until this moment. See also the note on visibility.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Close the DataStore. This should release any resources held by the implementation, so that the instance is ready for GC. All other DataStore methods cannot be used after this method was called. Subsequent calls of this method are ignored.
